archetype_name: Family Turkish & North African Suppers (Medium, 30–60, Intermediate)
name: Sheet-Pan Shawarma Chicken with Saffron Rice and Sumac Onion-Cucumber Salad
description: Roasted shawarma-spiced chicken thighs served over fragrant saffron basmati rice with a bright sumac onion-cucumber-tomato salad. Medium warmth and family-friendly components cooked on the stove and in the oven.
prep_steps: Heat oven to 220°C (425°F). Line a sheet pan with foil.
Rinse 2 cups basmati rice in cold water until it runs mostly clear; drain well.
In a bowl, mix 2 tbsp shawarma paste, 2 tbsp olive oil, 3 minced garlic cloves, zest of 1 lemon, juice of 1/2 lemon, 1/2 tsp chili flakes, 1 tsp salt, and 1/2 tsp black pepper.
Pat 800 g chicken thighs dry; toss in the marinade to coat.
Thinly slice 1 red onion. In a small bowl, combine onion with 1 tsp sumac, juice of 1/2 lemon, a pinch of salt, and 1 tsp olive oil; toss and let stand.
Dice 1 cucumber and halve 200 g cherry tomatoes; chop 1/2 bunch parsley (leaves and tender stems).
Warm 3 cups vegetable stock (or water) and crumble a small pinch of saffron into it.
cook_steps: Spread marinated chicken thighs on the lined sheet pan in a single layer. Roast 20–25 minutes until browned and cooked through (internal temp 75°C/165°F). Optional: broil for 2–3 minutes to char edges.
While chicken roasts, heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a pot over medium heat. Add rinsed rice and stir 1 minute to coat.
Pour in the warm saffron stock, add 1/2 tsp salt, bring to a boil, then cover, reduce heat to low, and cook 12 minutes. Turn off heat and rest covered 5 minutes.
Combine the quick-pickled onions with the cucumber, cherry tomatoes, and most of the parsley. Add 1 tbsp olive oil, a pinch of salt, and black pepper; toss. Adjust lemon to taste.
Fluff the rice with a fork.
Slice or leave chicken thighs whole. Serve chicken over saffron rice with the sumac onion-cucumber-tomato salad on the side. Garnish with remaining parsley and a pinch of sumac if desired.
